value.title: Improving Power BI performance when querying multidimensional models
value.excerpt: Starting with SQL Server 2019 Cumulative Update (CU) 5, DAX-based clients such as Power BI can use SuperDAX functions and query patterns against multidimensional models to boost query performance.

value.title: Release update for Sept 2020 release of Power BI Report Server
value.excerpt: In October 2018, we committed to you three releases of Power BI Report Server each year, to be shipped in January, May, and September.Â  We did this to provide transparency around the release timing and allow customers to plan their upgrade cycles accordingly.Â

value.title: AutoML now supports applying models in PQO Function Browser
value.excerpt: Previously, AutoML models could only be applied to entities in the same dataflow.  With this new capability, users don’t need to be an owner of the dataflow that has the model.Â  They can use models created by others in the same workspace.

value.title: Power BI data protection updates
value.excerpt: Recap of recent Power BI data protection features: Excel file to inherit the Power BI dataset’s MIP sensitivity label when using PivotTable connection , Sensitivity labels in embedded reports and dashboards â€“ public preview and Label inheritance upon creation of new content

value.title: Join Us! Monthly Power BI Dev Camp is Here! Starting August 27, 2020
value.excerpt: This month’s Power BI Dev Camp topic is “Developing with .NET Core”. Learn how to develop custom web applications for Power BI using .NET Core 3.1 and .NET 5. value.title: Re-imagine headers and navigation in the Power BI Mobile apps
value.excerpt: As Power BI becomes a key tool for decision makers, more and more content is being created and published for them. Being able to easily find that content, to navigate between related items, and to share relevant content with colleagues has become critical to making these users productive when using Power

value.title: Power BI Desktop August update released - here's all that's new
value.excerpt: With the latest round of updates being pushed to Power BI, a bunch of updated AppSource visuals have been highlighted, along with the introduction of new reporting, analytics, and further components.

value.title: Power BI Desktop August 2020 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: We have exciting updates this month! The updates include support for Perspectives in Personalize visuals, rectangular select for data points, dynamic formatting support to more visuals, Direct Query support for Q&A, several new AppSource visuals, and more! Check out the full blog to learn more about

value.title: Building cross-platform solutions that connect to Power BI datasets
value.excerpt: With XMLA endpoints available in Power BI Premium and the recent release of .NET Core versions of the Analysis Services client libraries (ADOMD.NET and AMO) in public preview, you can start building modern cross-platform Power BI solutions across Windows, Linux, and macOS, and cloud-oriented environments.
